title: Nervous System Awareness Check-in
description: Comprehensive assessment of your current nervous system state and trauma responses
questions: [{"id":"nervous-state","type":"radio","options":["Calm and regulated","Slightly activated","Moderately stressed","Highly activated","Shut down/numb"],"question":"How does your nervous system feel right now?","neuroscience":"This assesses your autonomic nervous system state. Each option represents different levels of activation in your sympathetic (fight/flight) or parasympathetic (rest/digest) systems."},{"id":"body-awareness","type":"text","question":"Where do you feel tension in your body right now?","neuroscience":"Trauma is stored in the body as chronic tension patterns. Identifying these areas helps you understand where your nervous system holds stress."},{"id":"hypervigilance","type":"radio","options":["Rarely","Sometimes","Often","Almost constantly","I don't notice myself doing this"],"question":"How often do you scan your environment for potential threats?","neuroscience":"Hypervigilance is when your amygdala (alarm center) stays constantly activated, scanning for danger even when you're safe."},{"id":"sleep-quality","type":"radio","options":["Deep and restful","Light but adequate","Restless and interrupted","Difficulty falling asleep","Frequent nightmares"],"question":"How would you describe your sleep quality?","neuroscience":"Sleep disturbances indicate an overactive nervous system. Your brain can't enter restorative sleep when it's in survival mode."},{"id":"emotional-regulation","type":"radio","options":["I can usually calm myself down","I need time alone to regulate","I feel like I'm going to explode","I shut down and feel numb","I panic and can't think clearly"],"question":"When you feel overwhelmed, what happens most often?","neuroscience":"This reveals your dominant stress response pattern: fight, flight, freeze, or fawn. Each response involves different brain regions and nervous system activation."},{"id":"triggers","type":"checkbox","options":["Loud noises","Crowded spaces","Unexpected changes","Criticism","Feeling trapped","Authority figures","Conflict","Being watched"],"question":"What are your most common triggers? (Select all that apply)","neuroscience":"Triggers are sensory or emotional cues that activate your amygdala's alarm response, often connected to past traumatic experiences."},{"id":"window-tolerance","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Very little","Quite a lot"],"question":"How much stress can you handle before feeling overwhelmed?","neuroscience":"This measures your 'window of tolerance' - the zone where you can handle stress without becoming overwhelmed or shutting down. Trauma narrows this window."},{"id":"recovery-time","type":"radio","options":["A few minutes","30 minutes to 1 hour","Several hours","A full day","Several days"],"question":"After a stressful event, how long does it typically take you to feel calm again?","neuroscience":"Recovery time indicates how efficiently your parasympathetic nervous system can restore balance after stress activation."}]

title: Trauma Response Pattern Assessment
description: Identify your primary trauma responses and understand how they served to protect you
questions: [{"id":"fight-response","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Never","Very often"],"question":"When threatened or overwhelmed, how often do you become angry, argumentative, or aggressive?","neuroscience":"Fight response involves sympathetic nervous system activation with increased adrenaline and cortisol to prepare for confrontation."},{"id":"flight-response","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Never","Very often"],"question":"When threatened or overwhelmed, how often do you feel the need to escape, run away, or avoid the situation?","neuroscience":"Flight response activates your sympathetic nervous system to prepare your body for escape, increasing heart rate and muscle tension."},{"id":"freeze-response","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Never","Very often"],"question":"When threatened or overwhelmed, how often do you feel paralyzed, unable to move, or like a deer in headlights?","neuroscience":"Freeze response occurs when your nervous system becomes overwhelmed and temporarily shuts down motor function while maintaining high alert."},{"id":"fawn-response","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Never","Very often"],"question":"When threatened or overwhelmed, how often do you become overly compliant, people-pleasing, or self-sacrificing?","neuroscience":"Fawn response involves suppressing your own needs to avoid conflict, often developing when other responses weren't safe or effective."},{"id":"response-awareness","type":"radio","options":["Very aware - I notice immediately","Somewhat aware - I notice after a few minutes","Barely aware - I realize later","Not aware - Others tell me","I don't know"],"question":"How aware are you of your stress responses when they're happening?","neuroscience":"Awareness is the first step in nervous system regulation. The prefrontal cortex needs to observe the amygdala's activation to begin calming it."},{"id":"childhood-responses","type":"checkbox","options":["Fighting back","Hiding or running away","Freezing up","Being extra good/compliant","Dissociating or 'leaving' mentally"],"question":"Which responses do you remember using most as a child?","neuroscience":"Early trauma responses become wired into your nervous system. Understanding these patterns helps you recognize why certain responses feel automatic."}]

title: Panic Response Readiness Assessment
description: Evaluate your current tools and confidence for managing panic responses
questions: [{"id":"panic-frequency","type":"radio","options":["Never","Rarely (few times per year)","Sometimes (monthly)","Often (weekly)","Very often (daily)"],"question":"How often do you experience panic attacks or intense anxiety?","neuroscience":"Panic frequency indicates how often your amygdala triggers false alarms. With proper tools, you can retrain your nervous system to be less reactive."},{"id":"panic-triggers","type":"radio","options":["Yes, I know my triggers well","Somewhat, I recognize some patterns","Not really, they seem random","No, I have no idea","I don't experience panic"],"question":"Can you identify what typically triggers your panic responses?","neuroscience":"Trigger awareness activates your prefrontal cortex (thinking brain) which can help regulate your amygdala (alarm brain) over time."},{"id":"current-tools","type":"checkbox","options":["Deep breathing","Grounding techniques","Progressive muscle relaxation","Medication","Calling someone","Removing myself from the situation","Distraction","I don't have tools"],"question":"What tools do you currently use when feeling overwhelmed? (Select all that apply)","neuroscience":"Having multiple regulation tools gives your nervous system options, preventing it from defaulting to old survival patterns."},{"id":"tool-effectiveness","type":"radio","options":["Very effective - they usually work","Somewhat effective - they help sometimes","Not very effective - they rarely work","Not effective - nothing seems to help","I don't have strategies"],"question":"How effective are your current coping strategies?","neuroscience":"Effectiveness depends on matching the tool to your nervous system state. What works in mild stress may not work in high activation."},{"id":"confidence-level","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Not confident at all","Very confident"],"question":"How confident do you feel about managing your next panic response?","neuroscience":"Confidence activates your prefrontal cortex and can actually prevent panic by reducing anticipatory anxiety."},{"id":"recovery-support","type":"radio","options":["Many people - I have strong support","A few people understand","One or two people","No one really understands","I prefer to handle this alone"],"question":"Who in your life understands your healing journey?","neuroscience":"Social support activates your ventral vagal system (calm and connected state) and provides co-regulation for your nervous system."}]

title: Self-Compassion Assessment
description: Evaluate your current level of self-compassion and identify areas for growth
questions: [{"id":"self_kindness_1","max":5,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Almost never","Almost always"],"question":"When I fail at something important to me, I become consumed by feelings of inadequacy.","reverse_scored":true},{"id":"self_kindness_2","max":5,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Almost never","Almost always"],"question":"I try to be loving toward myself when I am feeling emotional pain."},{"id":"common_humanity_1","max":5,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Almost never","Almost always"],"question":"When things are going badly for me, I see the difficulties as part of life that everyone goes through."},{"id":"common_humanity_2","max":5,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Almost never","Almost always"],"question":"When I think about my inadequacies, it tends to make me feel more separate and cut off from the rest of the world.","reverse_scored":true},{"id":"mindfulness_1","max":5,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Almost never","Almost always"],"question":"When I am feeling down I try to approach my feelings with curiosity and openness."},{"id":"mindfulness_2","max":5,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Almost never","Almost always"],"question":"When something upsets me I get carried away with my feelings.","reverse_scored":true},{"id":"inner_critic","type":"radio","options":["Very harsh and critical","Somewhat critical","Neutral","Somewhat kind","Very kind and understanding"],"question":"How would you describe your inner voice when you make a mistake?"},{"id":"emotional_regulation","type":"checkbox","options":["Criticize myself for feeling this way","Remind myself that others have it worse","Try to distract myself","Acknowledge my feelings with kindness","Reach out for support","Practice self-care"],"question":"When you are struggling emotionally, what do you typically do?"},{"id":"perfectionism","max":5,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Strongly disagree","Strongly agree"],"question":"I hold myself to very high standards and am hard on myself when I do not meet them."},{"id":"self_acceptance","max":5,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Strongly disagree","Strongly agree"],"question":"I accept my flaws and imperfections as part of being human."}]
scoring_rubric: {"subscales":{"mindfulness":{"items":["mindfulness_1","mindfulness_2"],"description":"Balanced awareness of present experience"},"self_kindness":{"items":["self_kindness_1","self_kindness_2"],"description":"How kind and understanding you are to yourself"},"common_humanity":{"items":["common_humanity_1","common_humanity_2"],"description":"Recognition that struggle is part of human experience"}},"self_compassion_levels":{"low":{"range":"10-24","description":"Self-compassion is an area for significant development.","recommendations":["Start with basic self-compassion practices","Consider therapy or guided programs","Focus on self-kindness fundamentals"]},"high":{"range":"37-50","description":"You have a strong foundation of self-compassion. Continue nurturing this valuable skill.","recommendations":["Practice advanced self-compassion techniques","Share your self-compassion skills with others","Focus on maintaining your practice during difficult times"]},"moderate":{"range":"25-36","description":"You have some self-compassion skills but there is room for growth.","recommendations":["Practice daily self-compassion exercises","Work on your inner critic","Focus on common humanity practices"]}}}

title: Inner Critic Awareness Assessment
description: Identify your inner critic patterns and their impact on your well-being
questions: [{"id":"critic_frequency","type":"radio","options":["Rarely","Sometimes","Often","Very often","Almost constantly"],"question":"How often do you notice self-critical thoughts?"},{"id":"critic_triggers","type":"checkbox","options":["Making mistakes","Comparing myself to others","Receiving feedback","Starting new projects","Social situations","When things do not go as planned"],"question":"What situations most commonly trigger your inner critic?"},{"id":"critic_voice","type":"radio","options":["Harsh and attacking","Disappointed and judgmental","Worried and anxious","Stern but well-meaning","Gentle but concerned"],"question":"When your inner critic speaks, the tone is usually:"},{"id":"critic_impact","type":"checkbox","options":["Makes me procrastinate","Causes anxiety and stress","Prevents me from trying new things","Affects my relationships","Lowers my self-esteem","Motivates me to do better"],"question":"How does your inner critic affect your daily life?"},{"id":"self_talk","type":"radio","options":["Be very critical and harsh","Be somewhat critical","Be neutral","Be somewhat encouraging","Be very kind and supportive"],"question":"When you talk to yourself, you are more likely to:"},{"id":"mistake_response","type":"radio","options":["I am so stupid","I should have known better","This is frustrating","Mistakes happen to everyone","I can learn from this"],"question":"When you make a mistake, your first thought is usually:"},{"id":"comparison","max":5,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Never","Always"],"question":"How often do you compare yourself negatively to others?"},{"id":"perfectionism_pressure","max":5,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Strongly disagree","Strongly agree"],"question":"I feel like I have to be perfect to be worthy of love and acceptance."}]
scoring_rubric: {"critic_levels":{"low":{"description":"You have good self-awareness and relatively balanced self-talk","recommendations":["Maintain your positive self-talk practices","Help others develop healthier inner dialogue","Focus on advanced self-compassion techniques"]},"high":{"description":"Your inner critic is quite active and may be causing significant distress","recommendations":["Practice compassionate self-talk daily","Challenge critical thoughts with evidence","Consider therapy for additional support","Focus on self-compassion exercises"]},"moderate":{"description":"Your inner critic is present but manageable","recommendations":["Continue building awareness of critical patterns","Practice reframing negative self-talk","Develop a more compassionate inner voice"]}}}

title: Emotional Processing Assessment
description: Assess your relationship with emotions and ability to process them healthily
questions: [{"id":"emotion_awareness","max":5,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Not aware at all","Very aware"],"question":"How aware are you of your emotions as they arise?"},{"id":"emotion_acceptance","type":"radio","options":["Try to push them away immediately","Feel overwhelmed and consumed","Judge myself for feeling this way","Try to understand what they mean","Accept them as part of being human"],"question":"When difficult emotions arise, I typically:"},{"id":"emotion_expression","max":5,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Very uncomfortable","Very comfortable"],"question":"How comfortable are you expressing your emotions to others?"},{"id":"difficult_emotions","type":"checkbox","options":["Anger","Sadness","Fear","Shame","Guilt","Disappointment","Loneliness","Jealousy"],"question":"Which emotions do you find most difficult to experience?"},{"id":"emotional_coping","type":"checkbox","options":["Distract myself","Isolate myself","Talk to someone","Exercise or move my body","Practice breathing or meditation","Criticize myself for feeling this way"],"question":"When you feel overwhelmed by emotions, what do you typically do?"},{"id":"emotional_validation","max":5,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Strongly disagree","Strongly agree"],"question":"I believe all emotions are valid and have important information."},{"id":"emotional_intensity","type":"radio","options":["Overwhelming and uncontrollable","Intense but manageable","Moderate and balanced","Mild and easy to handle","Numb or disconnected"],"question":"My emotions feel:"},{"id":"emotional_recovery","type":"radio","options":["Minutes","Hours","Days","Weeks","I stay stuck in the emotion"],"question":"After experiencing strong emotions, how quickly do you usually feel balanced again?"}]
scoring_rubric: {"emotional_processing_levels":{"healthy":{"description":"You have a healthy relationship with your emotions and good processing skills","recommendations":["Continue your emotional awareness practices","Help others develop emotional intelligence","Focus on advanced emotional regulation techniques"]},"developing":{"description":"You are developing emotional processing skills with room for growth","recommendations":["Practice daily emotional check-ins","Work on accepting difficult emotions","Learn healthy emotional expression techniques"]},"struggling":{"description":"Emotional processing is challenging and may benefit from additional support","recommendations":["Consider therapy or counseling","Start with basic emotional awareness exercises","Focus on self-compassion during difficult emotions","Practice grounding techniques for emotional overwhelm"]}}}

title: Pattern Awareness Assessment
description: Evaluate your current level of self-awareness and pattern recognition skills
questions: [{"id":"awareness_level","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Never aware","Always aware"],"question":"How often do you notice your emotional reactions before they fully take over?"},{"id":"trigger_recognition","type":"radio","options":["I have no idea what triggers me","I recognize some triggers","I know most of my triggers","I am very aware of my triggers"],"question":"How well can you identify what triggers your stress responses?"},{"id":"pattern_frequency","type":"radio","options":["Very frequently","Often","Sometimes","Rarely"],"question":"How often do you find yourself repeating the same unhelpful behaviors?"},{"id":"story_awareness","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Not aware at all","Very aware"],"question":"Rate your awareness of the stories you tell yourself about your worth and capabilities"},{"id":"habit_control","type":"radio","options":["No control","Little control","Some control","Good control","Strong control"],"question":"How much control do you feel you have over changing unwanted habits?"}]

title: Behavioral Pattern Inventory
description: Assess your current behavioral patterns and their impact on your wellbeing
questions: [{"id":"coping_strategies","type":"checkbox","options":["Isolation","Rumination","Distraction activities","Physical exercise","Talking to others","Journaling","Substance use","Creative activities"],"question":"Which coping strategies do you use most often when stressed?"},{"id":"relationship_patterns","type":"radio","options":["The helper/rescuer","The people-pleaser","The controller","The avoider","The balanced partner"],"question":"Which role do you most often take in relationships?"},{"id":"communication_style","type":"radio","options":["Avoid it completely","Get aggressive/defensive","Give in to keep peace","Try to control the outcome","Communicate needs clearly"],"question":"How do you typically handle conflict?"},{"id":"self_care_patterns","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Very inconsistent","Very consistent"],"question":"Rate how consistently you engage in self-care activities"},{"id":"boundary_patterns","type":"radio","options":["Almost always","Often","Sometimes","Rarely","Almost never"],"question":"How often do you say yes when you want to say no?"}]

title: Thought Pattern Analysis
description: Identify your most common thinking patterns and their effects
questions: [{"id":"negative_thoughts","type":"checkbox","options":["Catastrophizing","All-or-nothing thinking","Mind reading","Fortune telling","Self-blame","Comparison","Perfectionism","Helplessness"],"question":"Which negative thought patterns do you experience most?"},{"id":"thought_awareness","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Never catch them","Always catch them"],"question":"How often do you catch negative thoughts as they happen?"},{"id":"thought_impact","type":"radio","options":["Completely control my mood","Strongly influence my mood","Somewhat affect my mood","Minimally impact my mood","I control my response to thoughts"],"question":"How much do your thoughts affect your mood and behavior?"},{"id":"reframing_ability","type":"radio","options":["Not skilled at all","Beginner level","Developing skills","Moderately skilled","Very skilled"],"question":"How skilled are you at challenging and reframing negative thoughts?"},{"id":"rumination_frequency","type":"radio","options":["Almost constantly","Very often","Sometimes","Rarely","Almost never"],"question":"How often do you get stuck in repetitive worry or analysis?"}]

title: Boundary Health Assessment
description: Evaluate your current boundary-setting skills and identify areas for improvement
questions: [{"id":"boundary_confidence","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Very uncomfortable","Very comfortable"],"question":"How comfortable do you feel saying no to requests that do not align with your priorities?"},{"id":"guilt_levels","type":"radio","options":["Overwhelming guilt","Significant guilt","Moderate guilt","Minimal guilt","No guilt"],"question":"How much guilt do you typically experience after setting a boundary?"},{"id":"boundary_consistency","type":"radio","options":["Very inconsistent","Sometimes consistent","Usually consistent","Very consistent"],"question":"How consistently do you maintain your boundaries once you have set them?"},{"id":"energy_protection","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Very poor protection","Excellent protection"],"question":"Rate how well you protect your time and energy from being depleted by others"},{"id":"pushback_handling","type":"radio","options":["I give in immediately","I feel guilty and sometimes give in","I struggle but usually maintain the boundary","I calmly restate my boundary","I confidently maintain my boundary"],"question":"How do you typically respond when someone pushes back against your boundaries?"}]

title: Boundary Violation Recognition
description: Assess your ability to recognize and respond to boundary violations
questions: [{"id":"violation_awareness","type":"radio","options":["I often do not notice until much later","I notice but ignore it","I notice but am not sure how to respond","I notice and usually respond","I notice immediately and respond clearly"],"question":"How quickly do you notice when someone is crossing your boundaries?"},{"id":"physical_boundaries","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Very uncomfortable","Very comfortable"],"question":"Rate your comfort level with setting physical boundaries (personal space, touch)"},{"id":"emotional_boundaries","type":"radio","options":["Almost always","Often","Sometimes","Rarely","Almost never"],"question":"How often do you take on other peoples emotions or problems as your own?"},{"id":"time_boundaries","type":"radio","options":["Very poorly","Poorly","Somewhat well","Well","Very well"],"question":"How well do you protect your time from being overcommitted?"},{"id":"workplace_boundaries","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Very poor","Excellent"],"question":"Rate your ability to maintain professional boundaries at work"}]

title: Communication Style Assessment
description: Evaluate your boundary communication patterns and effectiveness
questions: [{"id":"communication_clarity","type":"radio","options":["Very unclear/indirect","Somewhat unclear","Moderately clear","Clear","Very clear and direct"],"question":"How clearly do you communicate your boundaries to others?"},{"id":"explanation_tendency","type":"radio","options":["Almost always","Often","Sometimes","Rarely","Almost never"],"question":"How often do you over-explain or justify your boundaries?"},{"id":"conflict_comfort","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Very uncomfortable","Very comfortable"],"question":"How comfortable are you with potential conflict when setting boundaries?"},{"id":"manipulation_resistance","type":"radio","options":["I give in easily","I struggle but sometimes resist","I resist about half the time","I usually resist successfully","I consistently resist manipulation"],"question":"How well do you resist guilt trips, manipulation, or pressure tactics?"},{"id":"relationship_impact","type":"radio","options":["Damaged most relationships","Caused some relationship strain","Mixed results","Improved some relationships","Significantly improved relationships"],"question":"How has setting boundaries affected your relationships?"}]

title: Nervous System Awareness Assessment
description: Evaluate your current awareness and understanding of nervous system states
questions: [{"id":"state_awareness","type":"radio","options":["Not aware at all","Slightly aware","Moderately aware","Usually aware","Very aware"],"question":"How aware are you of your nervous system states throughout the day?"},{"id":"activation_triggers","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Cannot identify at all","Can clearly identify triggers"],"question":"How well can you identify what triggers your nervous system activation (fight/flight)?"},{"id":"shutdown_recognition","type":"radio","options":["I rarely notice until much later","I sometimes notice during","I usually notice as it happens","I often catch it early","I can sense it before it happens"],"question":"How quickly do you notice when you are moving into shutdown or freeze states?"},{"id":"regulation_capacity","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["No ability to regulate","Strong regulation skills"],"question":"Rate your current ability to consciously regulate your nervous system"},{"id":"body_awareness","type":"radio","options":["Very disconnected","Somewhat disconnected","Neutral","Somewhat connected","Very connected"],"question":"How connected do you feel to body sensations and signals?"}]

title: Regulation Techniques Assessment
description: Assess your experience with and effectiveness of various regulation techniques
questions: [{"id":"breathing_effectiveness","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Not effective at all","Very effective"],"question":"How effective are breathing techniques for regulating your nervous system?"},{"id":"movement_preference","type":"radio","options":["Gentle stretching","Walking or light exercise","Shaking or bouncing","Yoga or mindful movement","Dance or expressive movement","I am not sure yet"],"question":"Which type of movement or somatic practice feels most regulating for you?"},{"id":"sensory_preferences","type":"text","question":"What sensory experiences most help you feel calm and regulated?"},{"id":"activation_recovery","type":"radio","options":["Hours or days","1-2 hours","30-60 minutes","10-30 minutes","Less than 10 minutes"],"question":"How long does it typically take you to return to calm after activation?"},{"id":"daily_practices","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["No consistent practices","Very consistent daily practices"],"question":"Rate your consistency with daily nervous system care practices"}]

title: Stress Response Patterns Assessment
description: Identify your personal stress response patterns and triggers
questions: [{"id":"primary_stress_response","type":"radio","options":["Fight - anger, irritation, confrontation","Flight - anxiety, restlessness, avoidance","Freeze - paralysis, indecision, feeling stuck","Fawn - people-pleasing, over-accommodation","A combination of responses"],"question":"What is your most common response to stress or perceived threat?"},{"id":"stress_recovery","type":"radio","options":["Very poorly - stress affects me for days","Poorly - stress lingers for hours","Moderately - I recover within a few hours","Well - I bounce back fairly quickly","Very well - I recover quickly and completely"],"question":"How well do you recover from stressful events?"},{"id":"early_warning_signs","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Cannot recognize signs","Can clearly recognize early signs"],"question":"How well can you recognize early warning signs of nervous system dysregulation?"},{"id":"environmental_sensitivity","type":"radio","options":["Very insensitive","Somewhat insensitive","Moderately sensitive","Quite sensitive","Extremely sensitive"],"question":"How sensitive are you to environmental factors (noise, crowds, lighting)?"},{"id":"support_system","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["No support","Very well supported"],"question":"How supported do you feel in managing nervous system health?"}]

title: Integration Progress Assessment

questions: [{"id":"skill_application","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Rarely apply skills","Consistently apply skills"],"question":"How consistently are you applying Phoenix Method skills in your daily life?"},{"id":"pattern_awareness","type":"radio","options":["I still do not notice until much later","I sometimes notice during","I usually notice as they start","I often catch them early","I can sense them before they activate"],"question":"How quickly do you now recognize old patterns before they take over?"},{"id":"boundary_maintenance","type":"radio","options":["Very inconsistent","Somewhat inconsistent","Moderately consistent","Usually consistent","Very consistent"],"question":"How well are you maintaining boundaries you have set?"},{"id":"nervous_system_regulation","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Very poor regulation","Excellent regulation"],"question":"Rate your current ability to regulate your nervous system during stress"},{"id":"relationship_changes","type":"radio","options":["Relationships have become more difficult","Little change in relationships","Some positive changes","Significant positive changes","Dramatically improved relationships"],"question":"How have your relationships changed since beginning the Phoenix Method?"},{"id":"self_compassion","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Very self-critical","Very self-compassionate"],"question":"How has your level of self-compassion evolved?"}]

title: Transformation Impact Assessment
description: Assess the overall impact of your Phoenix Method journey across different life areas
questions: [{"id":"emotional_regulation","type":"radio","options":["No improvement","Slight improvement","Moderate improvement","Significant improvement","Dramatic improvement"],"question":"How much has your emotional regulation improved?"},{"id":"life_satisfaction","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Much worse","Much better"],"question":"Rate your overall life satisfaction now compared to when you started"},{"id":"stress_management","type":"text","question":"How do you handle stress differently now?"},{"id":"personal_growth","type":"radio","options":["Boundary setting","Emotional regulation","Self-compassion","Pattern awareness","Nervous system regulation","Communication skills"],"question":"What area of personal growth are you most proud of?"},{"id":"future_confidence","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Not confident at all","Very confident"],"question":"How confident do you feel about maintaining your progress long-term?"},{"id":"support_systems","type":"radio","options":["Very inadequate","Somewhat inadequate","Adequate","Good","Excellent"],"question":"How adequate do you feel your current support systems are?"}]

title: Future Growth Planning Assessment

title: Phoenix Purpose Discovery Assessment
description: Assess your understanding of your unique purpose and calling
questions: [{"id":"purpose_clarity","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Very unclear","Crystal clear"],"question":"How clear are you about your Phoenix purpose and calling?"},{"id":"gift_recognition","type":"radio","options":["I do not see any gifts","I see some gifts but doubt their value","I recognize my gifts but feel hesitant to share them","I clearly see my gifts and want to share them","I fully embrace my gifts and am ready to serve"],"question":"How well do you recognize the unique gifts that have emerged from your healing journey?"},{"id":"service_motivation","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Not motivated","Extremely motivated"],"question":"How motivated are you to use your experiences to help others?"},{"id":"readiness_level","type":"radio","options":["Not ready - need more healing","Somewhat ready - building confidence","Mostly ready - preparing to act","Ready - taking first steps","Fully ready - actively serving"],"question":"How ready do you feel to step into purposeful service?"},{"id":"service_area","type":"radio","options":["One-on-one mentoring","Writing and sharing your story","Speaking to groups","Advocacy and system change","Teaching and education","Creative expression for healing"],"question":"Which area of service most calls to you?"},{"id":"legacy_vision","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["No vision","Very clear vision"],"question":"How clear is your vision for the legacy you want to create?"}]

title: Service Readiness Assessment
description: Evaluate your readiness for purposeful service and identify support needs

title: Phoenix Transformation Impact Assessment
description: Assess the overall impact of your complete Phoenix Method journey
questions: [{"id":"overall_transformation","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Minimal transformation","Complete transformation"],"question":"How would you rate your overall transformation through the Phoenix Method?"},{"id":"life_satisfaction","type":"radio","options":["Significantly worse","Somewhat worse","No change","Somewhat better","Significantly better","Completely transformed"],"question":"How has your overall life satisfaction changed since beginning the Phoenix Method?"},{"id":"relationship_quality","type":"text","question":"How have your relationships improved through the Phoenix Method?"},{"id":"daily_functioning","type":"radio","options":["Much worse","Somewhat worse","No change","Somewhat better","Much better","Dramatically improved"],"question":"How has your daily functioning and wellbeing improved?"},{"id":"future_confidence","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Not confident","Very confident"],"question":"How confident do you feel about your future and continued growth?"},{"id":"phoenix_identity","max":10,"min":1,"type":"scale","labels":["Do not identify","Strongly identify"],"question":"How strongly do you identify as a Phoenix - someone who has risen from adversity stronger and wiser?"}]
